intro: Trichodesma zeylanicum f. angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved trichodesma, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Asia. It is a member of the Leguminosae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and is often found in disturbed soils. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it has a fibrous root system. The leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, giving it its specific epithet "angustifolium."
